intro: Silene micropetala var. cheiranthifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy texture, and the plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and succulent stems. This variety is distinguished by its more elongated leaves compared to the typical form of Silene micropetala.
